thread.title: Algeria: Cereal Import Bill Down 4.56 Percent in First Eight Months of 2015
thread.title_full: Algeria: Cereal Import Bill Down 4.56 Percent in First Eight Months of 2015

title: Algeria: Cereal Import Bill Down 4.56 Percent in First Eight Months of 2015
text:
Egypt/Nigeria: Egypt Will Bank On Fans' Support Against Nigeria - Minister 
Algiers — Algeria's import bill of cereals (wheat, barley and maize) totalled US$ 2.33 billion during the first eight months of 2015, against nearly US$ 2.45 billion during the same period in 2014, down by 4.56%, said the Algerian Customs' National Centre of Statistics and Data Processing (CNIS). 
This drop is mainly due to the decrease in prices on the global cereal market owing to the abundance of supply and the decline in Algeria's barley and maize imports. 
In terms of quantity, Algeria imported 8.84 million tonnes of cereals during the first eight months of 2015, against 8.22 million tonnes a year earlier, up by 7.6%, said the CNIS. 
Except for wheat (hard and soft), which showed an increase of over 2%, barley and maize dropped by 2.4% and 20.45% respectively, according to figures provided by CNIS. 
Wheat import bill amounted to US$ 1.66 billion, against nearly US$ 1.63 billion, up by 2.03% during the same period of reference. 
In terms of quantity, Algeria imported 5.61 million tonnes of wheat during the first eight months of 2015, against 4.96 million tonnes during the same period a year earlier, up by 13.10 %. 
Algeria's maize import amounted to US$ 550.72 million (2.70 million tonnes) against US$ 692.34 million (2.76 million tonnes) during the same period of reference, down by 20.45% in terms of value and up by 2.5% in terms of quantity, said the CNIS. Algeria
